intro: Canthium polycarpum, commonly known as the many-fruited spurge, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. The plant is native to regions in Africa and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadside areas and forest margins. Canthium polycarpum has smooth, green stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is a herbaceous plant that can grow up to 2 meters in height, making it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
